summary:
## The Twelve Apostles of Jesus

The Twelve Apostles were Jesus' closest followers during his life, according to the New Testament. They were sent by Jesus to teach his message after his resurrection. 

Although Judas Iscariot betrayed Jesus, the other eleven apostles traveled to spread Jesus' teachings. Even Paul, who wasn't one of the original twelve, considered himself an apostle. This time period is known as the Apostolic Age.
title: Apostles in the New Testament
